Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [breathing heavy over intercom, starts laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This morning the phone guy comes in, and he shows Michael that the phones have a PA function. And then he just left.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [over PA] This is your captain speaking, the office will be flying at an altitude of two stories. Look out your left hand window and you will see Vance Refrigeration. [snickering] I am the ghost of salesman past, do not come near me. [wheezing laughing, starts coughing] Yes Michael Scott for Dr. Jocelyn, please. Hello doctor I was just following up on my mole again. No, I was looking online about sebaceous cysts. I have not been squeezing it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [disgusted groan]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could I stick it with a pin?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [still talking over PA] Toby Flenderson to the principal's office. Your mother called, and it appears that you wet the bed again. So you have to get home to wash your sheets [Jim stands up, puts scissors in back pocket] because they are yellow and they're wet with your urine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sighs and knocks on Michaels door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You, and at six foot six, from the University of North Carolina, Jiiiiim Halpeeeeert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's pretty funny. Hey you know what? Did I drop my, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What the heck? Is that, uh... [bends down, cuts phone cords with scissors]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You find it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't, I'll look somewhere else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you like fries with that? Please drive around.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knocks on Pam's hotel door] Hello, good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You ready? And we're off, like a herd of turtles.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Pam and I have eloped. Actually we just robbed a bank, and we are on the lam. [laughs] No, uh, seriously, I am on a lecture circuit. Apparently Scranton has the best sales of any regional branch. So David Wallace has asked me to go to all the branches, except Nashua, still a little bit raw there. Um, but I am going to these branches and sharing my secret recipe for success. My 11 business herbs and spices, in a sales batter. [looks at Pam] Oh that, well, that is Pam. Pam is coming along as my assistant and my driver so I can focus. And I like to pack heavy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He brought a sled.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! That is a toboggan, you never know when you're gonna find a snowy hill so... Every magician has a hot assistant, and every rock star has a roadie, and Pam is my hot roadie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I love being on the road, but I especially love the time and a half pay 24 hours a day, for three days. Cause I have a mortgage now, got a bring home the bucks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, oh don't say bucks, it's not lady like. Here we go! [gets in backseat] Okay so what we do is drive all day and we stay in hotels together at night.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Separate rooms.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well that goes without saying.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm going to say it anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Look at what you're wearing again, Pam. Have you ever seen a magician's assistant? That's...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is a new cardigan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...kind of [retches] Maybe you could tie it around your waist or lose the shirt underneath or something.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Oh, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [front door slams, Kelly walks by] Hey, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Screw you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me, that is no way to address a superior.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh yeah? Screw you too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa! What was that all about.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You forgot her birthday, it was yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim and Dwight sitting next to each other in talking head interview] Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go ahead, you do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I insist.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Basically after Phyllis blackmailed Angela, Michael asked them to both step down from the party planning committee cause there was too much drama.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What he said was... [puts finger toward Jim's face]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [pushes Dwight's finger away] Just, easy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...there was a problem with having one head of the party planning committee. She becomes too powerful, so he appointed two heads.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Party planning is literally the stupidest thing I have ever done in my life.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [at the same time as Jim] I am a paper salesman, this is humiliating. [shoves Jim's arm away] That's on my side.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So this is fun.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: My birthday was yesterday, and everybody forgot. I got really dressed up and excited, and no one said a word. There wasn't even a party. I think sometimes people are really mean to the hot, popular girl.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can I turn on the radio?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I need silence or Sam Kinison to prepare.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But then you fall asleep and there's nothing for me to do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Then listen to your iPod, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's dangerous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well then... hey you know what then let's just talk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's okay I can... I'm fine. I'll just play a song in my head.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You nervous about seeing Karen again, since she was the other woman? Actually you were the other woman so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, that was a long time ago.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is that why your wearing makeup today?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I'm not even wearing that much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I hate the idea that someone out there hates me. I even hate thinking that Al-Qaeda hates me. I think if they got to know me, they wouldn't hate me. But Karen knows me, and she still hates me, so...

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: Oh, this is a nice office.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [laughs] You don't have to lie. Through here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um Phyllis, who's that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: She's out of your league Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: For your information, I have been with lots of beautiful women.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sexually?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This conversation is over.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am single now. What we have here, is the ultimate smackdown between the Nard-Dog and crippling despair, loneliness, and depression. I intend to win.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We just wanted to say we are very sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Screw you guys. You're dead to me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you say screw you one more time...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, screw you, beefer, I don't forget your birthday, I would never do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, HEY.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [while Dwight and Kelly are arguing] Guys guys guys guys guys guys. We just want to make it up to you. What can we do?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I guess my only wish, would be that nothing so terrible would ever happen to anyone else ever again.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: In a way, it's good that it happened to me, because at least I can bear it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What kind of cake do you want imbecile.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ice Cream.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [taking Michael's picture] Okay, uh, point at the Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Rolando, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Rolando
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rolando, [clears throat] I'd like you to meet Pam. She is our receptionist. You know what? Maybe you guys could go out on a little friend date sometime.

Quote.Speaker: Rolando
Quote.Text: [sarcastically chuckles] Uh, your late, everyone's already in the conference room. Karen will be right here to take you over.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, don't be nervous, just picture her naked.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop it, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what I do, steal my trick.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Please cut it out.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey. Hi, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [notices Karen's pregnant] Oh my God. Is that Jim's?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Of course not!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Wow. Oh man! My head just exploded. Whoo! Thank God, for everybody right? Whoo kay. Wow, you're huge! That's incredible! I... God sorry, sorry my head is... I'm just, I'm trying to figure out the last time that you and Jim had sex, and...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Let's just get this over with, shall we?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Mm Hmm. Ten, ten months?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [partially blown up balloons on table and hanging from streamers] Are you kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I'm not done yet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight. This, [picks up balloon] fits in the palm of my hand. You haven't blown 'em up enough. Why have you chosen brown and gray balloons?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They match the carpet

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is that? [looks at sign that says "IT IS YOUR BIRTHDAY."] It is your birthday period.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a statement of fact.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not even an exclamation point?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is more professional. It's not like she discovered a cure for cancer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't believe how bad this looks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you trying to hurt my feeling? Because if so, you are succeeding. Fortunately, my feelings regenerate at twice the speed of a normal man's.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, good then.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you collected the money from everyone?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am working on it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How much do you have?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Six dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [yelling] That's how much you and I contributed! I... Damn it Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I said I was working on it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [looking into Julia's car] Trying to see what CD's she got. It's good to know the deets about the girl you're wooing. Eh, Aha! Fiest. Yes! [bangs on car and alarm goes off] Whoa! Aah, Aah! [backs up and runs into another car starting another alarm]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on cell phone] NO! Oh, my God. Oh, No. That is so awful. That is the worst news. I have to go. I have to do a presentation. I'll talk to you... [hangs up phone, sighs] This is going to be hard for me to speak today. Because I just learned that my father has died. ... No, he didn't! He is alive. And this isn't even a cell phone. This is a calculator. But you bought it! And now you can't return it. Or can you? No you can't. [Karen raises her hand] Yes. Karen, do you need to go pump?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Not gonna have to do that, till after I have the baby. No, I am wondering. What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am talking about, how you all need to sell an experience. Like I sold you on the idea that my father had died.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: But now we think you're a liar.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would a liar bring mini Mounds bars? [Pam tosses a handful of Mounds bars at everyone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am a theatrical person. Growing up, I always thought I would become an actor. Because I have, these memorization tricks that I use. Um, for instance, I learned the Pledge of Allegiance by setting it to the tune of Old MacDonald. [starts singing] I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America, and to the republic for which it stands, one nation under God. With a woof-woof here, and a woof-woof there. Here a woof, there a woof. Everywhere a woof, woof. Um, you get it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know you. But I need to know you in order to sell to you. That is why I have asked you to go around and tell me you names. I have an amazing mnemonic device, by which I have memorized all of your names. Shirty, mole, lazy eye, Mexico, baldy, sugar boobs, black woman. I have taken a unique part of who you are, and I have used that to memorize your name. Baldy, your head is bald. It is hairless. It is shiny, it is reflective like a mirror. "M" your name is Mark.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Got it. It works.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Uh, it's very insulting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But it works. I would like you all to give this a shot. What do you say?

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: But we already know each other's names.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then it will be easier for you. But I, I still think it's worthwhile, to give a, give it a try.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Okay. All right everyone, meeting's over.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I still have more.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Can I please see you in my office, please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She is pregnant. She is knocked up. "K" Karen. Pam, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: I can't accept these prices, Stanley. They just cut our budget.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Brought you guys some coffees. Stanley, I know you have adult onset diabetes. So I put Splenda in yours. Let's see. How many did I put in there? [starts singing to the tune of Feist's 1234] One, Two, Three, Four Splenda's in your coffee, Stanley. None in yours, Julia, cause I don't know how you take it. But if you'd rather...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Four Splenda. Are you crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, No, I actually only put in two. But that's not how the songs goes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Are you out of your damn mind?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you out of your damn mind? You bring an angel like that into this office, and you don't even set me up with her.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We're not friends. I didn't think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We are friends. Stanley, we're friends. And you let me down.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You really like her, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. I really like her with all my heart.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [thinks for a moment] Give me two clients for her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I grab this [grabs a chain saw], and I turn it on and I say, "Prepare yourself, for the Utica chain store massacre."

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: No that's, that is incredibly dangerous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, don't worry, the chain is off.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: You know, I think I'm just gonna distill all this, and send it in an email to my team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Email's not scary. This is an opportunity. Don't, don't blow it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So when are you due?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Uh, in about a month.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, that is wonderful, congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thank you. It just all happened so fast.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's really amazing. Congratulations Karen. So is there a guy or, uh, a person. Or, uh, a sperm machine that did this to you, or?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yes, Michael. My husband impregnated me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, great.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: His name is Dan, uh, this is us. So dorky.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, he's cute.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, he's so cute. He's a dermatologist. We met a bar. Can you believe that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What is happening there? [points at picture]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Don't even. That's really dorky.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's really sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's really dorky. You were right the first time.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: So, how are things in Scranton? How's Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, they're good. Uh, Jim's good. We're engaged.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That's so great. That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. I'm so happy for you. [hugs pam]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Old hatreds dissolve into new friendships. It's a really wonderful moment.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I have to take care of a couple things. So Andy will be taking over things here. You're in good hands, and give my best to your mother.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So Julia, um, let's see. With regards to, uh, billing. Should we send bills to you, or to your boyfriend's house or?

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: No, it could go straight to our business address.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh Okay, all right. That makes sense. How does your boyfriend, deal with your phenomenal success? Is he just, like, totally threatened by you, or?

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: Actually, I, I don't have a boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [stammers] Really? Is that... wow, that's so weird.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Guys, stop everything. I'm about to ask out this girl, and I'm completely panicking.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [quietly] Oh, my desk is over... [quickly walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: This gal, she's really into you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah. I mean, I've seen her, like, three times today. And we love all the same music, and whenever I walk into a room, she totally looks up.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: All right, all right. Say no more. So, this is how I got squeaky fromme. No small talk. Just show her who's the boss. Just go right in and kiss her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, it sounds risky.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Have I ever steered you wrong, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wait, what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would give that lecture a solid B+. Although, for the record, Karen. Wow, kind of mean.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? No, honestly. Tell me what you really think.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm serious. Um, I'm really glad I came.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because, um, cause I'll never wonder ever again. If I did something wrong and... Now I have closure. She's happy and, I don't know, it feels good.

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: Thanks for walking me out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, my pleasure. Yeah, there's all kinds of weirdo's out here, so...

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: You must be freezing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am about to die. [laughs] Will you wait here while I go get my jacket?

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: Oh, no, it's okay. This is my car.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, Okay. Well listen, you're a new client, and as one of my new clients, you will always be taken care of. And that is the Nard-Dog guarantee.

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: What's a "Nard-Dog"?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [points to self] This is the Nard-Dog.

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: [Andy leans in to kiss her] Whoa. What the hell?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Oh I, I thought we had this energy. And I'm a mess. And I just had my heart broken. And you came in today and your so pretty. You're, like, incredibly pretty.

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: I just got out of a relationship too. It's really hard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, right? Wow. Yeah. Do you want to talk about it? Go to a mall of something? Just walk around?

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: No, I, I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure, yeah that's... your right. It's too soon for... definitely too soon for me. So I'm glad we go that out of the way. I'm gonna be in touch with you. In three months. I'm gonna call you about that order. And maybe about that mall walk.

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Take care Julia.

Quote.Speaker: Julia
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [as Julia is pulling out] Sorry I tried to kiss y...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We lost the account.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [struggling to blow up a balloon as his desk phone rings] Damn it! [answers phone] Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [over the phone] How old's Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who is this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's Mose. Who do you think it is?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mose doesn't know how to use a phone. So joke's on you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look, I'm at the supermarket, and they only have numbered candles. How old is she?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you think I'm calling you for your best approximation?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] I'll call you back. [goes to a filling cabinet takes out a file and looks around]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have here Kelly Kapoor's personal and confidental file. Allow me to share. [opens file] "Kelly Kapoor spent April 1995 to December 1996 at Berks County Youth Center." Juvie. "According to past employers, it in no way affects her job perfor..." Blah, Blah, Blah. [closes file]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you asleep?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I'm just thinking about what you said, about Karen, about closure. You remember Holly? She used to work for H.R.?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, remind me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Blonde hair, nice boobs. Not too big, not too small.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Perfect boobs, [gives a look at the camera] of course I remember Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She was the love of my life. What you and Jim have times 100. Just she... she just left. And I didn't... I never got closure, you know? I never got closure with her. I haven't talked to her since. I haven't seen her since. And I feel like I need to go to Nashua and get closure. I feel like I need that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, lets go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [scoofs] I'll just blow off the lecture at Rochester.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, screw 'em. Let's do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [leaning against Creed's desk] So I am collecting $3 from everybody. For Kelly's party.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'd like to contribute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, great.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [opens wallet and hands Jim a single bill] There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looks at a three dollar bill]
